item.title: podman and docker-compose in Ubuntu 22.04.3 (WSL2)
item.description:
Ubuntu reports fairly old version od podman in its default apt registry.

Here I will present how to install podman 4.6.2 from separate apt. Afterwards, we’ll also configure podman socket, install docker-compose and run example scripts.

System

I am using wsl2 with ubuntu 22 lts:

âžœ lsb_release -a
No LSB modules are available.
Distributor ID: Ubuntu
Description: Ubuntu 22.04.3 LTS
Release: 22.04
Codename: jammy

Adding apt repository

Stock ubuntu does have podman but in ancient version 3.x something. To install newer version using apt, we need to add a kubic repository, as suggested in podman readme.

item.title: Configuring raspberry pi 1
item.description:
This is a draft notes of my journey to set-up raspberry pi 1 (the oldest one, on arm v6 procesor), and some notes about syncthing

  1. Execute parted command to start
parted
  1. Suppose, /dev/sda is the device on which to remove the partition. Use the parted commnad with the /dev/sda device as shown below:
parted /dev/sda
  1. View partition table to determine the minor number of the partition to remove:
print
  1. Remove the partition with the command rm. For example, to remove the partition with minor number 2:
rm 2
